Quite. The Crichton building had sub-basements under its sub- basements. I wonder what else Nimrod squirreled away, down here in the dark?

[FX: RUMBLE OF SHIFTING FOUNDATIONS OVERHEAD ]

(WALKING) .. will brutally murder every single man out there, given half the chance! Captain, please try to understand: the Word Lord’s from a dimension very different to ours, a dimension where language, not physics, is the very cornerstone of reality.
(WALKING, CARRYING OTHER DOCTOR) So you have to watch your mouth.
(WALKING) Say the wrong thing and he can alter this whole world as easily as you might correct a spelling mistake!
(WALKING, CARRYING OTHER DOCTOR) Say the wrong thing...?

[FX: TOSSES BREAD. EXCITED DUCKS. SPLASHES. FEW BEATS WITHOUT

[BEAT] [SIGH] Nah, forget it.

But does he, though? What right’s he got to choose that for me? I’m waking up after these last few years, and someone’s put this stranger in charge of my life.

It won’t be that easy, Ace. Words give a Word Lord power. The more words, the more power. Last time we crossed paths we were in Antarctica, with a communication dead zone on our side. Even then...
We were lucky to come out on top.

This time, we’re in the south of England. Even with Greater London evacuated, there are still countless conversations, phonecalls, announcements, TV and radio broadcasts happening here every single moment.

The truth, Hex wants the truth. Where to start? Ah-ha. Yes. Here we go. The most important truth you never learned, Hexy- boy, is when the chips are down, the Doctor only ever thinks about himself.

Nobody.

Oh no...

[ANGRY] It never ends, does it? The Forge, then you, then Cybermen, Daleks, sky falling in. Death, disaster, lies — it never ends! Well, I’m not playing this game anymore. Do you hear me? I’m not playing!

Run?

Sometimes.
